This manual explains how to use Software Store.

chapter.title: What is the Ubuntu Software Store?
chapter.para: The Ubuntu Software Store is a virtual catalog of thousands of free applications available for Ubuntu. You can find applications by category or by searching, and you can install an application with the click of a button.
The Store also lets you examine the applications that are installed already, and remove those you no longer need.

sect1.title: Starting The Ubuntu Software Store
sect1.para: There are two ways to start the Ubuntu Software Store:

orderedlist.listitem:
From the main menu, select
System Administration Ubuntu Software Store
To run the Software Store from the command line, run: software-store pkgname Where pkgname is an (optional) name of a package to open the Software Store at.

sect1.title: Main Window
sect1.para: When you start the Ubuntu Software Store, the following window is displayed.
The main window of consists of the following:

listitem.para: Menu bar - allows you to perform specific actions, filter the software displayed or look for help.
Navigation pane - displays the different parts of the Software Store.
Main Pane - shows the software available from the category chosen from the software catalog column.
Location bar - indicates where you are in the Software Store.
Search field - searches for a piece of specific software.
Status bar - displays information relating to what you are currently viewing.
